name: They Breathe
description: They Breathe is a short journey into the depths of a forest filled with water. As you swim deeper, it's up to you to figure out the rules of an insidious ecosystem where nothing is as it first seems, and where everyone is after the same precious resource â€“ oxygen!
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows XP Processor: Single Core 500 MHz Memory: 1 GB RAM Graphics: 512 MB RAM DirectX: Version 9.0c Storage: 512 MB available space

reviews.review_text: Interesting and unsettling.  Gave me a very real feeling of dread that I can only describe as ' I do not want to be here '. No popscares or sudden loud noises. Just a damn good example of how environment design, sound mixing and unique mechanics can set such a great mood.  Unfortunately contains a few (seemingly random) game-breaking bugs where enemies refuse to spawn. It's a short game though (~30 minutes), so starting over doesn't feel like much of a chore.  Highly recommend.

They Breathe is a strange game that can not be categorized into any genre. You play as a frog that jumps into a body of water. Not sure if it is a pond or what. Your goal is to save as many drowning frogs as you can by pushing them into air bubbles until they regain enough to swim away to the surface. I use the word goal lightly as it doesn't really matter if you save them or not. The two enemies is a cow like creature and a jellyfish which will consume you. If a jellyfish consumes a drowning frog it becomes much more powerful. You can defeat these enemies by either waiting until they run out of breath or guiding them into air bubbles. They get stronger and faster when they get a air bubble so it may be better to simply out maneuver them until they drown.  Environments are cool and spooky looking the deeper down you go. The game itself actually has a creepy vibe to it which suits it perfectly considering all the animals you will see drown. The moody music you will hear throughout is pretty great too. There isn't really much to talk about this game as it is a very simple game and also about 20 minutes long. It's not an expensive game by any means but that may turn some people off. Not much to do other than dodge enemies and collect bubbles to stay alive. That does lead to some pretty cool moments where you have to decide if your own life is more valuable than the random drowning frog next to you. Even if you die though you will respawn in the last check point which will be just right before an enemy encounter.  I don't really see the point of dragging this review out. This is a good and interesting game with a very memorable ending. The short length of the game is both a blessing and a curse. On one hand it keeps the simple gameplay from getting stale but on the other hand it is a 20 minute game. I do think this is a game worth experiencing but do expect an artsy type of game instead of a gameplay focused one. It is certainly unique I'll give it that and it's visually appealing. Though there is no real reason to replay it once you finish so be sure of what you are getting when you purchase this. Recommended to those that want a very short but memorable experience.
Beyond Terrifying  I drowned all of the frogs
Short but very memoriable experience, make sure you are not eating while playing this game.
WTF is that
I always wanted to be a frog struggling for oxygen and now I can do just that.  Plus things try to kill me so it's more realistic you know, it's like I'm a REAL frog, not an imposter frog.
Fun and short game worth the money. I was both suprised and horrified by the great story and why you are the only frog at the beginning. Ending really suprised me!

While admittingly it is a short title. Only 1.5 out of the 9.5 hours played is time actually spent playing (Thank steam trading cards!). They Breathe is very engaging and immersive, due to the simple controls, non hand-holding, and great atmosphere provided by the effects (both audio and graphics). Easily worth the $2.

Absolutely fantastic game. It certainly makes an argument for games as experiences rather than mindless, graphics-focused fodder.  Gameplay had a nostalgic, almost retro feel (this is a good thing) - tight, simplistic controls, with thoughtful, challenging level design. Nothing is spoonfed, leaving it up to the player to deduce how to proceed as each adversary presents itself.  The atmosphere is fantastic, utilizing excellent sound design and unnerving imagery to produce an almost suffocating, dark tension. Even without an obvious storyline present, the game clearly communicates that the protagonist's objective is much more dire and grave than we're initially led to believe from the title screen.  I highly recommend this - $2 is an absolute steal for this surprisingly deep, beautiful work.
i play as a frog. 11/10

This game freaked me out the first time I played it, because it was not what I was expecting. The underlying irony and cruelty in the game really got me, but it was neverless an enjoyable play. I would definately reccomend this game.  The music was excellent. It was a very low, abianient style that had me connect with the game on a deeper level rather than just in-my-face loudness. Although the game did not have a huge variety of tracks and the tracks themselves were rather simple, this made it all the more enoyable to play along with.  Gameplay was also fairly great. The controls were simple and relatively easy to master and later on this was tested, which made the game much better. Parts of the gameplay were hard to grasp at first, like saving the frogs and the jellyfish stuff, which you needed to grasp fast or else you would restart the wave. The waves system was also an enjoyable part of the gameplay that made sense in context with the story.  Finally, the story. It's pretty simple, you can basiclly read the game discription and you won't get too much more storywise from playing the game. The twists and turns of the game and the game's exploition of this, however, made the simple story of a frog's 'there and back' more intresting and exciting.  Overall, I would reccomend this game to someone who enjoys simple, not blatently violent games with an indie touch to it. Once you complete it you basically never need to play it again but in my case I enjoyed playing this several more times and explored different stratagies of winning and achivement hunting. Definately an enjoyable play, 4.5 out 5 only because of the possibility of making it longer might have, in my opinion, made it better.

Bought this game on sale because I was told it was short, but now that I have played it I wouldn't mind paying the full price or maybe even more for this.  Art and backgrounds are amazing. Music and sound fit in very well. And by the time I got to the bottom I was extremely uncomfortable. I knew there was a surprise, but I don't think I could have expected what I found. The game tells a horrifying story without even saying a single word. There really are no explinations given in the game, so it is up to the player to make discoveries.   I found the game interting to play through again once I knew what was going on, but outside of that it doesn't have much replay value. I don't mean to say this as a negative thing, but just know that unless you are going for achievements you are going to get about 30 or so minutes out of this game.   Highly recommend, wish there were more games like this.

They Breathe is a game that is well worth the $2 it costs, the game itself is relitavely simple with basic controls and straightforward gameplay.  The experience however is where this game really pays itself off, the atmosphere as you go deeper had me on edge and really creeped out, and most games like that put me off, but this game pulled me more the deeper I went.  All I can really say is try the game, it's not a long game though it has replay value, but with the same cost of a morning coffee it  really  pays for itself with the experience you get, give it a try.

PROS:  - Nice frogs. - Nice jellyfishes. - Nice green jellyfishes.  CONS: - Too short (though achievements warrant multiple playthroughs.)  Final Remarks: Go to the  developer's website  [theworkingparts.com]  and type in 'jelly'.  They Breathe  is pretty much the developer's debut game and it turned out to be a damn good one.  . RECOMMENDED .

Wait for a sale.  Is They Breathe bad? No it's actually creative, interesting looking, and has some excellent (albeit creepy) sound design. The issue is the game is 20-minutes long at best, meaning the $2 price tag is a bit much for what is essentially a moody website game, thankfully on sale it's pennies on the dollar. I don't think it's a waste of time and actually think everyone should play it, it just doesn't feel like something you should be paying for to experience. But I suppose that's up to you and the devs.  There are achievements that could potentially add logetivity to the experience if that's your thing, but I feel they're misplaced in what is essentially and atmospheric art piece.  Still, check it out if you can pick it up on the cheap.
You play as a frog and drown mooses.  10/10
This is an excellent exercise in surrealist art.
A magical adventure with froggies and fishies, great fun for the whole family.

Quick Review: Get it on sale.  Slightly Slower Review: The Good: Creepy Atmosphere, Challenging game, really cool ideas for a small game done by school students. The Bad: Minimalistic Story, The game is just 10~15 Minutes long, but it can give you hellish time if you are after achievements.  That's It!

The game is great, definitley play it. However, I was challenged to either play 10 full hours of They breathe or complete every achievement. I only managed 4 hours and could not get 3 of the 8 achievements. I went into this a scared, excited and foolish boy and I came out as a changed, hardened and very damaged man. They breathe almost drove me to madness and resulted in an obssession that cost me my marraige. The amount of frogs sacrificed and the fact that they died in vain keeps me up at night. That is punishment enough. I'm sorry. I'm so very sorry, my amphibian amigo's. I couldnt save you.
A game about frogs, starts out innocent enough, and quite cute as well. Then They Breathe took my soul and used it as toilet paper.  10/10

This was a pretty interesting game which was pretty intense as I got deeper in the water. It was very challenging once you have like everything hitting you at once and avoiding the continuous moose ram was pretty hard. I actually bought this game during the winter sale on a pretty nice discount and the game definitly provided enough for the price I bought it for. Overall, other than the fact that there is no progression other than difficulty increasing as you get deeper, this was a pretty fun game to mess around with. I wouldn't play this in my free time, but it was OK for a game that I played a little after taking a break from a day of dota.  Rating: 7.6/10

With it on sale for less than a dollar, I thought 'eh, why not'.  While it isn't super creepy, it does (as others has mentioned) feel very eerie. There were a few moments where I thought, 'okay game, you're going too far', as it got stranger.  That said, it doesn't last very long at all, and the eerieness goes away after a short while. While it's not bad by any means, $2 may be a tad bit too much in my opinion.  Another thing is, as others have noted as well, it's just done...just to do it. There is no plot or story, although it's not hard to make up your own.
Not too bad of a game, great time waster, but I would rather go for super meat boy

A VERY short game (roughly 30 mins), but this does not mean that it's not worth the time. Sound effects and score set a dark and creepy atmosphere as you dive deep into the unknown; swimming calmly one minute and fighting off strange monsters of the deep the next. Surprisingly, there is a motive behind all this - one that isn't fully made clear to you until the end of the game, which makes this an exciting and satisfying play-through right until the last breath.
A fun little game about survival!
Well, that title got dark.
Wow. This is one messed up world.  Also, those mooses... Damn.

You are a frog chasing oxygen bubbles - that doesn't sound that cool. At first.  But once you started the game, you want to play it to the end, because you're not only chasing oxygen bubbles. You're fighting for them. There are many other creatures you have to defeat underwater to survive. This game shows the real world in a way you haven't seen it before.  There is no introduction, no tutorial to show you how to play the game; you have to learn it all by yourself. I first didn't get the sense of this, but after playing a few minutes, it was obvious that the developers want the player to feel like the little helpless frog in the game, having to get to know the environment (or the controls ;) ) in order to survive.  It's a really cool game, but only if you let the atmosphere have an effect on you.
Intriguing till the end. All that it could and should have been.  Its only 30min long so the first time only play it alone, without distractions and preferably in the dark.

Whether you were there for the stream or not, it went down. All the way to the bottom. Letâ€™s get started on this review.  I â€“ Story [10/10]  They Breathe from The Working Parts is what it is. It is a harrowing, terrifying journey through a flooded forest (gone mad) by the unlucky Glenn the frog. The deeper downward you swim, the more eerie and disturbing it gets. Itâ€™s your job to survive in a twisted ecosystem where the only thing that matters is getting oxygen. I wonâ€™t say too much else. If you were watching the stream (on Twitch or Steam) youâ€™ve seen it for yourself whether you pieced the story together or not. If you werenâ€™t watching the stream, youâ€™ll have to find out for yourself what makes this bizarre environment tick.  II â€“ UI [5/10]  They Breathe has almost no user interface whatsoever. From the moment you dive into the deluge, itâ€™s every frog for themselves. You are given one clue as to what you can do to swim faster, and boy will you need it. Aside from this, the only time any sort of directional HUD appears on screen is if you manage to swim outside of the current boundaries. While this is incredibly useful, I felt very conflicted about it because it detracted from the atmosphere of the game as a whole.  III â€“ Gameplay [10/10]  The controls of They Breathe are as simple as they come. Youâ€™ll make use of only two controls; swimming in any given direction and swimming faster in any given direction. Youâ€™re left to figure things out for yourself when it comes to offense.   IV â€“ Content [10/10]  What They Breathe lacked in physical content, they made up for in mental trauma.  V â€“ Visual [6/10]  The visuals of They Breathe are hand-drawn and, for the most part, are just alright compared to most other games who share that artistic trait. While subtlety creepy, I personally feel that they could have been better.  VI â€“ Audio [10/10]  The majority of the game is deathly quiet apart from water-like ambiance and the terror-inducing screams of your enemies. When the music does come though, it comes in at just the right moment.  VII â€“ Overall [8.5/10]  Overall, They Breathe is a fantastic game, especially for such a low price.

froggy swimmy. dont die and save ur pals   This was a fun short with nice graphics and a great soundtrack. I found this game through its emoticons, that I thought were hilarious. This game is interesting. You are Glenn, the frog who dives down into the depths of the water. I did not find this game scary, but the ending was sure interesting.  If I could add to this game, it would be to make the game longer, and to add another aspect to the game other than collecting air bubbles.  I recommend this for frog lovers.

You will only ever be horrified once throughout this game. Everything will be pretty creepy, sure. But you will come to a sudden realisation which you may work out half the way through, or right at the end. And when you come to that sudden realisation, you will excrete your intestines so hard that you'll open a hole in the space and time continium, take a time out, get some hot cocoa, hire a shrink, go through 6 months of rehabilitation, fly to Canada to face your fears, see a moose, have a nervous breakdown and hang yourself.
From the time I've been playing Diablo II, I've always knew -- it's something weird with damn cows
A simple game with a simple concept, yet freaky in ways that I didn't know were possible. It's only 2 dollars, and worth every cent.

'They Breathe' has to be the best horror game I have ever played! Giving you a choice between saving buddies' lives or using them to survive yourself... This cruel world has to be the meanest of all horror games... 10/10
A modern day Odyssey, this action-packed dark thriller stars an innocent frog on his journey through the darkness and depth of a strange, unfamiliar environment where every breath could be his last.
A Game Worth Far More Than $2

Generally a nice, very atmospheric interactive experience, which you should only pick up on sales as the 'game' only lasts 30 minutes, and oh boy, how great 30 minutes. Even though I paid the full price (1,99 euros) it was still worth it in my opinion. I don't feel like it's a game, hence the quotation marks. Instead of calling it a game, I would personally call it an interactive artwork. A beautifully executed one. After playing it through, it's up to you if you want to keep it or not. Trading cards are an additional PLUS  -Also, you don't buy artworks to just look at them once.

No steam overlay, no option to change rsolutions or from full screen mode to windowed mode, aweful graphics, better game play than a technical demo that would clearly out shine this little indie gem, 9/10, its a must get, from a bundle of course.

I'm still not entirely sure what this game is about or what it's trying to tell me, but it's cute, well made and you can finish it in your lunch break. And it costs less than a sandwich, and is probably healthier for you. So buy this instead.

It's not what you expect based on Kermit's sad cousin on the icon. Or maybe it is, if you have a horrifically grim mind.  They Breathe is a horror tale expressed entirely through realtime gameplay with no words or exposition. It's very short, but very much worth the price of entry to experience a very novel and chilling tale. Gameplay is simple but increasingly frantic. It's only about half an hour long, but it'll really stick with you.  BTW. You can save the frogs. I'm sorry, frogs. I'm so, so sorry.

This more or less the Citizen Kane of underwater oxygen bubble popping frog / frogcow games. Paid 61 cents, but would still be happy if I had paid 82. This is not your father's Frogger, that's for sure.
Frogs. Bubbles. Cow-jellyfish-thingies. Simple concept, yet executed beautifully.
This game is fantastic. Don't read any reviews or anything. It's just $2. Grab it and give it a go. Don't ruin anything beforehand.
this game creeps me out a lot. the eerieness of it makes me kinda jumpy for not reason too.
Creepy molesting Game!
A very interesting game, that twists your feeble mind when you finally realize...

The lil frogs struggle, the many lil frogs try... But most will probably not be able to do it.   As Gleen ( the frog ) you experience the fight to survive in a creepy environment while trying to save your suffocating mates and put an end to the corruption in the deep of the drowned forest. All that in around 12 mins.   The beauty of the creepy its the best way to show the reality.   Real piece of art. And it has a reference to Chrono Trigger :') 1999/10
This is so fun. But i never save a frog, not even one. I AM SO CRUEL

I shifted from yes to no for the last five minutes... And I finally decided that it's not worth your 2 bucks. Yep, there's great artwork but that's it for me. Really, the creepiest game you've ever seen? What is wrong with you people.

I played through the whole game once and even did some repetitions to get some achievements - Did I suffer during that time? Well, not exactly. But do I think it is as good as everyone seems to claim currently? No - definitely not.  It looks and feels like one of those flash game we had in the first half of the 2000s. You scroll down for 20 minutes and try to avoid getting hit by enemies. After that there is a little surprise, but the game is over nonetheless. So if you manage to get this game for (near) free from somewhere give it a try, but I can't really recommend it.
Too artsy fartsy for my tastes. Airbubbles heal frogs and hurt enemies. Simple gameplay and might be worth the $0.99 price tag, but the game is not really memorable.

I went into They Breathe expecting a larger reveal at the end and perhaps that was my mistake. Ultimately the game had a slightly disturbing atmosphere, though the enemies that were meant to be, I assume, the most disturbing suffered from a rather comical appearance. The final boss also leaned more towards annoying than difficult as it has you repeat several tasks a number of times when once is enough to get all the enjoyment you will from the 'challenge'.  For two bucks you can't really go wrong but you could do better. Understand that you're buying a half-hour game that, while mildly atmospheric, doesn't have a whole lot to offer in the way of gameplay.

6/10  The idea of this game is nice (I won't spoil it here), but I didn't find the game as emotionally impactful as many other people. Playtime is about 30 minutes, which is something I actually see as a positive. I wish there were more games which could tell a story and not require committing so much time to complete them.  I can somehow recommend this game if it's part of a bundle. $2 is not a lot, but it's not difficult to find better games that are on sale for roughly the same amount.

sad frog falls off log finds underwater moose, runs away from underwater moose, headbuts other sad frogs into bubbles, surgeon frog simulator saves frogs. glowing jellyfish stick frog to body spew out acid frog dies end of game repeat 3 times then ragequit
A little bit of a ingame tutorial would help. Got bored fast but was cheap for steam trading cards.
This is the epitome of pointless hipster indie garbage.

Another good reason not to fall into hype.  Personally this is a game I was somewhat excited to play. The art style looked fun, the theme of the game was interesting, and I suckered myself into thinking that it would be one of those indie games that would be great, after hearing great things about it. I was wrong. The game has no substance. Sure it could be creepy if you put yourself into that mindset, but in all reality, I felt no emotion towards the game whatsoever. The gameplay is basic. You use the arrow keys or WASD to move your little frog around the screen, and enemies come in waves to kill you. This helps push the game in the wrong direction in my opinion, as I felt like it become repetitive far too quickly, surprising being that the game is only a half an hour long. The ending made no sense and was stupid, but maybe I was supposed to do something that I didn't, I'm not sure. The game just felt like a waste of time to me, even though I payed a sum of about 70 cents on it.  My verdict: 4/10  There are better games out there for your money, just look for them. Don't let art style style fool you and don't believe people like Markiplier.

They Breathe is strange. On the one hand its a great little indie game with nice visuals, ambient music, interesting play style, story, etc.... On the other hand it is easily finished in 30 minutes and, to me at least, just wasn't satisfying. I mean, can a game really be that short and still be worth selling? I feel like the dev's should have made a few hours worth of content before releasing this. Its only $2.00 but I would much rather pay $10 for a game that I can play for longer than it takes me to eat my breakfast. Others have said it has replay value... I see none.

Well, They Breathe was over after half an hour but I have to say I had fun doing it. From what I worked out, the aim is to collect air bubbles for your frog while stopping the Jellyfish getting them...I think?   About five minutes in, you will think there are swimming cows underwater with you, but sadly they aren't, these are frogs trapped inside jellyfish, that just look like cows (and make the same noises)   I can't really recommend you pick this up at any other time, apart from when it's part of a bundle.
Greatest twist of 2014. 10/10

It's kind of like an avoider game that get's more difficult after each wave they throw more variants of the enemies at you. It's pretty neat, but I am glad I didn't pay full price for it. I can give it a yes if you like this sort of thing, or you're looking for something interesting however you should wait for a sale in my opinion.
Very dark for a very simplictic game. Will leave a reminder on the reality of survival. For 2 dollars highly reccomend it

This game is dark. When are jellyfish like The Borg from Star Trek, then when are The Borg like angry wildebeest? Welcome to the ecosystem of They Breathe. Save your friends or they will kill you with a smile on their faces. Just don't be afraid to use their dead bodies to win the game.   See, told you it was dark. Must play. This is an Indie Experience.
I don't really know what to say about this game other than it's really weird, really cute, and really frustrating.
Story told through gameplay and atmosphere. Fantastic mood game, noit very long but very good. A lot of emeotion pack in to a small box. Highly recommend!
Dark, Intense, Immerseful game. It's a really short game, finish it in one sitting for full effect. One of my favorites. :glennthefrog:
Very interesting game, worth every penny..
